org.researchstack.skin

Class DataProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.researchstack.skin.DataProvider

  • public abstract class DataProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to as a buffer between the network layer and UI layer. The implementation allows the framework to be backend-agnostic

      • getInstance

        public static DataProvider getInstance()
        Returns the singleton instance of this class.
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of this class

      • init

        public static void init(DataProvider instance)
        Initializes the DataProvider singleton. It is best to call this method inside your Application.onCreate() method.
        Parameters:
        instance - an implementation of DataProvider

      • initialize

        public abstract rx.Observable<DataResponse> initialize(android.content.Context context)
        Called in SplashActivity to initialize the state of the app. The state includes if the user is not signed in/up, not consented, etc..
        Parameters:
        context - android context
        Returns:
        Observable of the result of the method, with DataResponse.isSuccess() returning true if signUp was successful

      • uploadConsent

        public abstract void uploadConsent(android.content.Context context,
                                   org.researchstack.backbone.result.TaskResult consentResult)
        This method is responsible in uploading the user consent information (e.g. Name, Birthdate, Signature) to the backend
        Parameters:
        context - android context

      • saveConsent

        public abstract void saveConsent(android.content.Context context,
                                 org.researchstack.backbone.result.TaskResult consentResult)
        This method is responsible in saving user consent information (e.g. Name, Birthdate, Signature) locally.

        Please use FileAccess class to encrypt user information when saving.

        Parameters:
        context - android context

      • getUser

        public abstract User getUser(android.content.Context context)
        Returns the user object that contains any sort of information. This information can be collected in the inital survey and sorted using this object
        Parameters:
        context - android context
        Returns:
        User object

      • getUserSharingScope

        public abstract java.lang.String getUserSharingScope(android.content.Context context)
        Gets the current sharing scope of the user.

        This scope can be:

      • sponsors_and_partners
      • all_quali5dfied_researchers
Parameters:
context - android context
Returns:
the sharing scope of the user

  • setUserSharingScope

    public abstract void setUserSharingScope(android.content.Context context,
                                         java.lang.String scope)
    Sets the current sharing scope of the user. This method should tell the backend that the sharing scope has changed.
    Parameters:
    context - android context
    scope - the new sharing scope of the user

    Parameters:

  • loadTasksAndSchedules

    public abstract SchedulesAndTasksModel loadTasksAndSchedules(android.content.Context context)
    Loads the SchedulesAndTasksModel object, this should be used in conjunction with the ResourceManager if inflating the TaskAndSchedules object from assets folder
    Parameters:
    context - android context
    Returns:
    a SchedulesAndTasksModel object

  • loadTask

    public abstract org.researchstack.backbone.task.Task loadTask(android.content.Context context,
                                                              SchedulesAndTasksModel.TaskScheduleModel task)
    Loads a Task object, this should be used in conjunction with the ResourceManager if inflating a Task from assets folder
    Parameters:
    context - android context
    task - the TaskScheduleModel model
    Returns:
    a Task object with defined sub-steps

  • processInitialTaskResult

    public abstract void processInitialTaskResult(android.content.Context context,
                                              org.researchstack.backbone.result.TaskResult taskResult)
    This initial task may include profile items such as height and weight that may need to be processed differently than a normal task result. This task is presented to the user when initially entering the MainActivity
    Parameters:
    context - android context
    taskResult - initial TaskResult object to process

  • forgotPassword

    public abstract rx.Observable<DataResponse> forgotPassword(android.content.Context context,
                                                           java.lang.String email)
    Called during sign-in if the user has forgotten their password. This should make a network call to notify the backend.
    Parameters:
    context - android context
    email - email of the user
    Returns:
    Observable of the result of the method, with DataResponse.isSuccess() returning true if forgitpassword request was successful
